title: More efficient logic needed for sorting disk data when there are boundary values for row counts
description: When sorting data on disk, if sorting 40,000 rows and setting the program to process only up to 40,000 rows, the following operations are currently performed:
EB:
- Implement a more efficient logic for sorting disk data with boundary row values
- Sort the data directly in memory and then write it to a file
SR:
1. Prepare a dataset containing at least 40,000 rows
2. Enable sorting on disk
3. Set the program to process up to 40,000 rows
4. Observe the sorting process and note the performance
